page.title: 05KILMINGTON CONT'D
page.content: as the Manor of Chinemetona. The nearest town is Axminster, some three kilometres away. Axminster existed in 755 and was apparently an important site. A Roman road passes through the village of Kilmington, although all that remains of the original road is a fairly short stretch which is now tarmacked. {The buildings. Of the 155 dwellings we surveyed, 76 are houses, 53 are bungalows and 26 are cottages. There are varied styles and ages among the dwellings. One or two are mentioned in the Domesday Book, and the latest bungalow was completed last year. There are 47 houses which are over 100 years old, and 63 which are under 30 years old. We understand that thirty or forty more houses may be built soon.
